RamanAnalytics package

Submodules

RamanAnalytics.Analysis module

class RamanAnalytics.Analysis.EN[source]

Bases: object

Elastic Net:

Minimizes the objective function:

\[||y - Xw||^2_2 + \alpha * r * ||w||_1 + 0.5 * \alpha * (1 - r) * ||w||^2_2\]

The parameter r is the L1 ratio. r = 1 is the lasso penalty and r = 0 is the ridge regression penalty.

analysis(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test, Metabolite, def_alpha=None)[source]
Parameters

  • X_train – input data at training set;

  • X_test – input data at test set;

  • y_train – output at training set;

  • y_test – output at test set;

  • Metabolite – the name of output;

  • def_alpha – Regularization strength; must be a positive float.

class RamanAnalytics.Analysis.LA[source]

Bases: object

Lasso: Minimizes the objective function:

\[||y - Xw||^2_2 + \alpha * ||w||_1\]

This model solves a regression model where the loss function is the linear least squares function with L1 prior as regularizer (aka the Lasso).

analysis(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test, Metabolite, def_alpha=None)[source]
Parameters

  • X_train – input data at training set;

  • X_test – input data at test set;

  • y_train – output at training set;

  • y_test – output at test set;

  • Metabolite – the name of output;

  • def_alpha – Regularization strength; must be a positive float.

class RamanAnalytics.Analysis.PCR[source]

Bases: object

Principal component analysis (PCA) with Linear Regression.

PCA: Linear dimensionality reduction using Singular Value Decomposition of the data to project it to a lower dimensional space. The input data is centered but not scaled for each feature before applying the SVD.

Linear Regression: LinearRegression fits a linear model with coefficients to minimize the residual sum of squares between the observed targets in the dataset, and the targets predicted by the linear approximation.

analysis(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test, Metabolite, def_comp=None)[source]
Parameters

  • X_train – input data at training set;

  • X_test – input data at test set;

  • y_train – output at training set;

  • y_test – output at test set;

  • Metabolite – the name of output;

  • def_comp – number of components to keep

class RamanAnalytics.Analysis.PLS[source]

Bases: object

Partial least squares regression (PLS): find the multidimensional direction in the input space that explains the maximum multidimensional variance direction in the output space.

analysis(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test, Metabolite, def_comp=None)[source]
Parameters

  • X_train – input data at training set;

  • X_test – input data at test set;

  • y_train – output at training set;

  • y_test – output at test set;

  • Metabolite – the name of output;

  • def_comp – number of components to keep

class RamanAnalytics.Analysis.RR[source]

Bases: object

Ridge Regression: Minimizes the objective function:

\[||y - Xw||^2_2 + \alpha * ||w||^2_2\]

This model solves a regression model where the loss function is the linear least squares function with regularization is given by the l2-norm.

analysis(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test, Metabolite, def_alpha=None)[source]
Parameters

  • X_train – input data at training set;

  • X_test – input data at test set;

  • y_train – output at training set;

  • y_test – output at test set;

  • Metabolite – the name of output;

  • def_alpha – Regularization strength; must be a positive float.

class RamanAnalytics.Preprocessing.detrend[source]

Bases: RamanAnalytics.Preprocessing.GeneralTransformer

Normalizes each row of an input data.frame or matrix by fitting a second order linear model and returning the fitted residuals. The detrend is a row-wise transformation that allows to correct for wavelength-dependent scattering effects (variations in curvilinearity). A second-degree polynomial is fit through each spectrum

fit(spc)[source]
fit_transform(spc, wave, deg=2)[source]

Fit and transform the data

Parameters

  • spc – Input dataframe (row wise) with the Abs of each spectrum

  • wave – Wavelength array vector

Return detrended_df

spectra array or matrix

class RamanAnalytics.Preprocessing.msc[source]

Bases: RamanAnalytics.Preprocessing.GeneralTransformer

This function implements the multiplicative scatter correction method which attempts to remove physical light scatter by accounting for additive and multiplicative effects The Multiplicative Scatter Correction (MSC) is a normalization method that attempts to account for additive and multiplicative effects by aligning each spectrum (x_i) with an ideal reference one (x_r) as follows:

\[x_i = m_i x_r + a_{i}x_{i} = m_i x_r + a_i \text{MSC}(x_i) = a_i - x_{im_{iMSC}}(x_i) = a_i - x_i/m_i\]

where a_ia_i and m_im_i are the additive and multiplicative terms respectively.

fit(spc)[source]
Parameters

spc – Row wise input data frame

Returns

transform(spc)[source]
class RamanAnalytics.Preprocessing.sav_gol[source]

Bases: RamanAnalytics.Preprocessing.GeneralTransformer

Performs Savitzky golay smmothing.

fit()[source]
transform(spc, window=7, poly=3, deriv=0)[source]

Transform the data

Parameters

  • spc – Input row wise dataframe of spectra

  • window – The length of the filter window (i.e., the number of coefficients). window_length must be a positive odd integer.

:param poly:The order of the polynomial used to fit the samples. polyorder must be less than window_length. :param deriv: The order of the derivative to compute. This must be a nonnegative integer. The default is 0, which means to filter the data without differentiating.

Returns

smoothed data

class RamanAnalytics.Preprocessing.snv[source]

Bases: RamanAnalytics.Preprocessing.GeneralTransformer

fit(spc)[source]

Calculates Standard normal variate transformation by:

\[(x_i - x_{mean})/x_{std}\]
Parameters

spc – row wise dataframe of spectra. Each row is a different sample

Returns

Fitted object with mean and std.
